sentences.english: His face took on a set expression.
sentences.chinese: 他臉上現出凝滯的神態。

sentences.english: He saw only her long chestnut lashes , permeated with shadow and modesty.
sentences.chinese: 他只見到栗色的長睫毛，掩映着幽嫺貞靜的神態。

sentences.english: Under the Linden Tree, Buddha sat up in the middle and appeared calm.
sentences.chinese: 在菩提樹下，佛祖端坐中間，神態安詳。

sentences.english: The poem vividly describes how the goose swims and frolics on the water.
sentences.chinese: 這首詩寫了鵝遊戲時的神態，很生動。

sentences.english: Carreen liked him because of his placid and unembarrassed silences.
sentences.chinese: 卡琳喜歡他那種平靜而自在的默默無言的神態。

sentences.english: The manager sailed into the room.
sentences.chinese: 經理神態自若地走進房間。

sentences.english: Now a prig is a pert fellow who gives himself airs of superior wisdom.
sentences.chinese: 這種人魯莽無禮，總是擺出一幅有極高智商的神態。

sentences.english: His golden hair and magnific manner made him very attractive.
sentences.chinese: 他金色的頭髮和莊重的神態使他非常具有非凡的魅力。

sentences.english: Her manner professed a gaiety that she did not feel.
sentences.chinese: 她的神態顯出一種她並未實際感受到的快樂。

sentences.english: Margo changes swiftly into a first-lady-of-the-theater manner.
sentences.chinese: 瑪歌迅速地換成“戲劇第一夫人”的那副舉止神態。

sentences.english: He wore an air of serenity which rendered him singularly venerable.
sentences.chinese: 他神態安詳，使他顯得異樣地莊嚴可敬。

sentences.english: Huangshan Where visitors are a smiling, look foolish Ran.
sentences.chinese: 當遇上黃山遊人，一個個皆笑容可掬，神態憨然。

sentences.english: He was always composed; his manners, except on one or two occasions, were impeccable .
sentences.chinese: 他一直神態自若，除一兩次外，舉止態度都無懈可擊。

sentences.english: The Monkey sat up, grave and dignified, on the Dolphin's back.
sentences.chinese: 挺直腰板坐在海豚背上的猴子擺出一副莊嚴的神態。

sentences.english: Watch out for people that subtly imitate your gestures and expressions.
sentences.chinese: 假如有人刻意模仿你的動作或神態，你要對他小心了。

definition: living spirit, living image (idiom); true to life/vivid and realistic
cultured and refined (idiom); gentle and cultivated
mellow and full/suave/smooth and round/rich (in voice)
